welcome-screen.text: I am developer based in Rijeka, Croatia with over 4 years of experience in field

about-me.text: My name is Filip and I am a Croatian based student, musician and software developer. I started my journey at the age of 18 when I first learned programming working on Arduino and Arduino-based systems. Why Arduino? I went to engineering school and studied electrical engineering. After I finished In high school, I started college for electrical engineering and along the way, I found that I was more into software than into electrical engineering so I decided to switch college to telematics which I found to be more fun and challenging than electrical engineering.

1.title: Working as help in apartment complex @ Laguna Poreƒç
1.text: I worked as sesonal worker at apartment complex as part of housekeeping

2.title: Maitenance worker @ Student dormitory Trsat
2.text: I started working at student Centre Rijeka as worker on infrastructure. I was part of maitenance crew that did regular summer maitenance of the full complex

3.title: Receptionsit @ Student dormitory Trsat
3.text: When summer maitenance finished I got work as student receptionist at dorimtory Kampus Trsat.

4.title: Working as software developer @ Student Center Rijeka
4.text: I got offerd software developer job as part of my education and training as software developer. I was tasked to develop and incorporate new ideas into already given systems.

5.title: Working as technicain, data recovery specialist and general service technician @ BigBox
5.text: Got back to one of my passions: electronics, so I accepted postion @ BigBox as repair technican to reflect on my skills and to figure out what I want to do with my coding knowledge.

my-work.title: My work
my-work.text: I mostly do web development, but you can catch me doing a little bit of everything. Why? Well I like to read, explore and see what capabilities I have. I love to work in Typescript/Javascript for web development as they are super easy to work with but sometimes I will lean on python if I see I can do something better with it. You never know. I still do a lot of C/C++ as I started with C in high school and nostaliga hits sometimes bad.
my-work.text-2: My favorite projects are: GUMBO - Editor i OpenCVPuT(as this is my bacc. thesis)
